The original Half-Life is just a masterpiece. It's difficult but it's just a great game that I don't think can be matched anymore.

I was reluctant at first, after the first ten minutes I was a hooked, after the first hour I was a fan, after I finished it however I was stunned. I genuinely think this might be the Citizen Kane, On the Waterfront and Rambo I, II & III all rapped into one but as a game. I got proceeded to get everything remotely connected to the Half-Life name. The original Half-Life is still magic though. At this point I not only recommend this game to everyone, It's a right of passage to manhood. Play it, on hard, the play it again, then download Sven Co-op and play it with friends, then get brutal HL, then get Black Mesa.

game

I wanted to like this game so much.  But I honestly find myself struggling to play much more than a few hours.  It does have great puzzles, but I find myself wanting to play games like Doom or Goldeneye 64 over this.  I want to love this game so much.  I love games from this era, but I cannot bring myself to playing much more.  For 2021, its rough to play.  But the game has my respect for what it was able to do back then. And while it is not for me, I can see many people enjoying it to this day.  For this reason, I am giving it a positive recommendation.

Gordon Freeman in the flesh. Or rather, in the hazard suit. I took the liberty of relieving you of your weapons; most of them were government property. As for the suit, I think you‚Äôve earned it. The borderworld, Xen, is in our control for the time being, thanks to you. Quite a nasty piece of work you managed over there. I am impressed.	
That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm here, Mr. Freeman. I have recommended your services to my employers, and they have authorized me to offer you a job. They agree with me that you have limitless potential.	
You‚Äôve proved yourself a decisive man, so I don‚Äôt expect you‚Äôll have any trouble deciding what to do. If you‚Äôre interested, just step into the portal and I will take that as a yes.	
Otherwise...well...I can offer you a battle you have no chance of winning. Rather an anticlimax, after what you‚Äôve just survived.

The name of this title reminded me of the name we gave to this kid called Mike. Mike suffers from diabetes, he would be force fed foods that would raise his blood sugar levels to the point of a chronic stroke. The final time I saw him was when he was on his death bed, half of his face looked like a moldy, sausage roll from Greggs. Mike begged me to end his pathetic life before his 8 year old sister who suffers from leukemia and had a shiny, bald head. I thought to myself that the girl kinda looks like a head-crab from half-life.

only play this game if you are a boomer who played quake 30 years ago.  gunplay is pretty bad, movement is too slippery, there is way too much platforming, fighting the aliens and the latex black chick spies who run at mach speed is beyond irritating.  enough cheap deaths to make dark souls jealous.   modern games have plenty of problems for sure but so do these ancient geezer shooters.  $2 is a fair price if you know what you're getting into but do not pay any more than that.

I truly do not know as to why to this day people lose themselves over this game,  back in 1998 im sure it was a fun game however playing it in the present it is downright  horrible. The controls are awful and unresponsive, it feels like you are on ice. The level design is awful too, it doesnt feel fun or interesting at all. It is very repetitive. It is a hard game only because of its clunky controls and poorly created and thought out levels. This game is the definition of overrated in every sense of the word. This game is not worth $10 dollars by any means.

I really enjoyed Half-Life. I was really excited to finally play this game and it did not disappoint for the most part. The one thing I really loved about the game is that it's very much one big seamless experience. Loading between different areas is done in a mostly non-intrusive way (at least as much as technology at that time could allow), and all of the "cutscenes" and dialogue are integrated into the gameplay. This, coupled with the eerie music and ambience allows you to really get immersed in the world, like you really are Gordon Freeman going on this journey. The combat feels good and the problem solving to get through the different areas and challenges is really satisfying when you finally get it right. There were some parts of the game where it was a little confusing on what to do, and its easy to occasionally get lost, but for a game made in '98 it holds up surprisingly well.
